Reviews.Title: “Except for getting robbed.............”
Reviews.Author: Darcy A
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this particular Bastion Hotel in 2008 for 7 days (that was the plan). The service was great the staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed them. The hotel was clean and the beds were comfy. (2 single beds were great for my friend and I but would not have been acceptable for my husband and I) Access to the internet in the lobby was helpful for keeping in touch with family and also checking itineraries for the next part of our trip.the hotel was undergoing some external upgrades but the noise did not effect our stay. The location was not in the midst of everything but you could get to all the action in minutes on a short bus ride. (We purchased multi-day transportation passes for the city transportation services) All in All we had a great first 6 days! We were headed to Switzerland the next day by euro-rail. We decided to go have a quick dinner, come back and pack up for the next days trip. We got back from dinner and somebody had climbed the scaffolding on the back of the building and pushed in our window and took the whole safe out of room, the safe was not secured properly, but "hidden" in a closet. In it was our passports and my friends entire wallet. We went across the street (literally) to the police substation to get the police and it took 45 minutes because nobody actually mans that particular station. We finally got them, they said they would have to come back the next day and take prints etc.etc. We had to stay another night, and pay for it. The manager did give us free meals. We did eventually get replacement passports in Bern, Switzerland. The consulate in Amsterdam was horrible and unhelpful, it was like being robbed of something even more valuable than the passports ~ dignity and hope! They actually made us feel like the criminals! Upon our return to the US I tried to contact Bastion Hotels to discuss our incident at their hotel and could not get in touch with them in any way shape or form. For months I tried. They had all my info, and were aware of the incident and never contacted me either. This lack of concern and professionalism by the company itself will keep us from ever staying at another Bastion Hotel anywhere. Thankfully I took travel insurance for myself (my friend skipped it) and I was reimbursed by my policy for most of the inconvenience, including the replacement passport, extra hotel nights in Amsterdam and Bern, and extra meals and train travel. Thank you CSA and my friends Tom and Don for insisting I get travel insurance! Moral of this review: If the safe is not nailed down, don't trust it! And ask why it isn't! Buy trip insurance, it was less than $80 and worth every penny!! If traveling abroad leave $120 with a trusted family member or friend so the consulate can call them for you and request they wire the money directly to them. They will not allow you to make a call, nor will they accept anything but cash from you!!!(I had my Chase Master Card, they would not take it) Oh and you can not receive a Western Union transfer in another country with out a passport.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, peaceful area easy to get to and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Longalion
Reviews.Content: We visited for 3 days and 2 nights Amsterdam. On arrival I had to pay a 5% city charge, the staff were great arrived and checked in at 11am. Previous to my arrival I emailed the hotel to ask for directions to which I had a quick and easy to follow response, get train to Centraal St from airport, then bus numbers 32 & 33 (left of station) to hotel which was about 6 stops or 10 mins away. Room was a usual business room two single beds, clean sheets so all good. I never ate their as Amsterdam has a lot to offer. Would return back to hotel for sure so definately a good choice. Just not too sure about the 5% charge for entering the city?? Should be included in the bill to avoid being charged on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Harpotheton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight en-route to Germany. Bit hard to get car parked but only a 10 minute busride into Amsterdam centre. Room was good, clean and quiet. Made a major error in leaving a LARGE sum of cash in the room. This was located and kept securely by the hotel reception until I was able to stop by and collect it a week later. I'd stay here again no worries.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises, that's good!”
Reviews.Author: ridler36man
Reviews.Content: On a par with a premier inn or travelodge in the uk, decent sized room and level of attention from staff. Added bonus of a free car park which was the main reason for choosing this hotel as we were making a few trips outside of Amsterdam. Easy 10 minute bus into central station, so if you are looking for a medium quality reasonably priced room then this could be it.

Reviews.Title: “Stag........”
Reviews.Author: brumeeboi
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel with uber helpful staff - receptionist even found me a room at 00:19 when she had been off duty for 30 mins! Cheap beer and generous measures if you are a whisky drinker. Decent buffet breakfast and a good bus service into town. Perfect for a short stay. Would defo stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy hotel in a green residential neighborhood, very close to city center by bus!”
Reviews.Author: Vartuhi
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel in a quiet and peaceful neighborhood located in close proximity to downtown. Didn't really need any assistance from the front desk staff, but they did seem quite friendly! They let you leave your bags at the reception after you check out and are really cool about it! Free computer to get online in the lobby, Wi-Fi in the rooms is ok too. Rooms are cleaned daily, although if you like to sleep in do hang the 'do not disturb" sign on the door. The cleaning starts a little after 10 and they should be done with all the rooms by noon.Overall, very pleased with the hotel. Great for people who would like to have their down time and get some sleep away from the hustle and bustle of the city!

Reviews.Title: “More of business hotel but good location for the City”
Reviews.Author: holidays4
Reviews.Content: Location looked rough at first glance but was not and is right next to a police station, parking was ok. Access to the centre is easy by bus they run every 5-10 minutes to the centre until midnight then there are less frequent night busses. By a public transport ticket for the days you are staying itâ€™s much cheaper than paying for single trips on the bus. The breakfast finished at 9am sharp which was too early and it got full from 8 onwards. Do not book breakfast it is a rush unless you are on business. There is a separate smoking lounge with TV which my smoking wife liked. Twin room was a good size just a very good shower no bath, we did not hear any building work.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gemzie_howard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over new years and was very pleased with this hotel. The surroundings at first doesn't look great but most places outside the centre are the sames and is quitesafe as it is opposite a ploice station. We arrived at the hotel about 10am not expecting to check in till 2pm but were given our room straight away. As check out is at 12pm they are happy to look after your bags if you have a later flight. The hotel is modern and clean throughout and the room was just right, they are all twins beds, TV, fridge, a kettle with coffee and tea and very clean. The maids came daily and were very friendly. The staff were very friendly and helpful and responded to all requests straight away. Breakfast was brilliant, very impressed for what we paid, scrambled eggs, bacon, boiled eggs, can fry your own eggs, cereal, all sorts of breads, yogurts and croissants, tea, coffee and juiceplus more. Beware...when we arrived at the main station in Amsterdam we were'nt sure what buses to get so we grabbed a taxi, were told it would be 15 euros. When we arrived at the hotel we were told they took us the long way round so beware and it shouldn't cost more than around 10 euros. It is best to get the hotel to book your taxi. If not the buses are very easy once you know where to get them from. The bus stops are right outside the main station and you need to get bus 32 and 33 and get off at Rode Kruisstraat and the hotel is a 1 minute walk from stop. The buses are not that cheap for single and returns and if you are planning to take trips into the centre and around the area it is much cheaper if you go to the GVB bus information centre which is literally opposite the station as you walk out. We got a 4 day bus pass for 18 euros for one person. Single and returns are about 4 euros each time per person so it is worth getting a pass for the time you are staying. All in all, the hotel was very pleasant and great location for getting to the centre with a 5 minute bus ride. BUT it was absolutelt freezing around this time, heating in hotel brilliant, can almost get too hot but as we spent most of our time walking around we needed at least 2 jumpers, coat, scrave, hat and gloves!

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and clean. BUT...”
Reviews.Author: LxIris
Reviews.Content: The receptionists were very friendly and provided guides of Amsterdam and useful tips. My room had more than enough space for one person (it had two beds) and the curtains where thick enough so that I could sleep comfortably. The extra municipal tax (5 euros) was a bit unexpected. The bathroom had a tub with a fixed shower head - a bit uncomfortable... The surrounding area is not very pretty, but the bus stop was very near and the bus (32 or 33) takes us to the central railway station in 10 minutes, and are quite regular (every 15 minutes, say). The most unpleasant item about this hotel was that some friends that came with me WERE CHARGED FOR A CHOCOLATE THEY NEVER CONSUMED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price & convenient to get into town”
Reviews.Author: Franco-Files
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights as we were travelling with a car and wanted free parking whilst sightseeing in Amsterdam. It was everything we needed - clean, reasonable sized room, even tea & coffee facilties in the room, friendly staff. Car parking was just outside but not secure although there's a police station just over the road but we never felt it was a risky area. We didn't have any meals in hotel, prefering to have late breakfast/ lunch/ dinner in town. Buses to/from town were very frequent (just 50m from hotel) and journey only 8-10mins max. Buy a Euros 7.30 strippenkaart for best deal when travelling on public transport - great value and two of you can use the one strippenkaart until all the tickets (15) are used up. From the main station to/from the 3 main canals, use the minibus shuttle for Euro 1 per hour - stop it anywhere en route and jump on and off as many times as you like during the one hour - but don't forget to keep your ticket! Think it's called Stop & Go (or something similar) Great food at the Pancake Bakery (Prinsengracht 191 - near Anne Frank museum). Great afternoon tea, cocktails and decor (Art Deco) at the Schiller Bar in Rembrandtplein 26 then take a look inside the foyer at the Art Deco Tuschinski Cinema in Regulierbreestraat just NW of Rembrandtplein - FANTASTIC! Go to cafe at the top of the clock tower at Metz & Co department store on junction of Keizersgracht & Leidestraat - great views & nice food but I think you will have to book for a window table in tourist season. Only one word of caution - watch out for muggers! We nearly got stung but a 6th sense warned of someone getting too close behind and we thwarted him - he was working with 2 others in a triangle pincer movement in broad daylight in the main tourist area..

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised....”
Reviews.Author: BaxterFamily
Reviews.Content: My husband works in Amsterdam, so i had the opportunity to spend a couple of nights there. I was pleasantly surprised by the place. It reminded me of a Travel Lodge but with a restaurant. The breakfast was also a pleasant surprise too. I was expecting the usual continental fare, but there was scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, along with the yogurts, pastries, fruit and cereals and bread to toast if you so required. We had a basic clean room, but for the two nights that i stayed there, it was sufficient. The buses run every 10-15mins or so which is a 2 min. walk from the Hotel. They take you to Central Station, and if you wish, you can get a tram from there to just about anywhere around the city, and quite cheap too. I would certainly stay there again for the convenience of where it is.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SimmySheffield
Reviews.Content: The Bastion Deluxe is a great base from where you can explore the delights of Amsterdam. The hotel is about 10mins by bus from the central station in Amsterdam (route 32 or 33) .You approach the front (which seems like the back) of the hotel via a carpark,past a Japanese restaurant. After arriving early for check-in we filled out the booking forms,left our luggage and headed back into the city.On our return we gained access to our room (No. 24),a very pleasant room,the only drawback that there was no bath just a shower wetroom but very clean & plenty of hot water. We spent each evening dining in the hotel restaurant,which was very quiet,with excellent food and reasonable priced meals & drinks. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, free WiFi....sloooow service”
Reviews.Author: pompeydaz
Reviews.Content: Good location, just out of the centre, bus stop right outside though where you can catch the bus to central station. Free WiFi is good for business travellers. Service at the bar and restaurant was very slow. Meals took ages to come to our tables, some items weren't available. Rooms were clean and tidy. Nice shower and bathroom. I wouldn't like to stay here for longer than the 2 nights I did though !! Definitely recommend going into amsterdam for food and drink rather than stay on-site.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but close enough to the centre”
Reviews.Author: Jiggerz
Reviews.Content: Having listened to friends comments about more central hotels and the noise, especially from the trams in the wee small hours, we opted to stay slightly out of the centre and this was a good choice. It's only about 10mins on the bus from Centraal Station and the buses are very frequent with an hourly night service after midnight. Check in was hassle free, just the usual forms etc and we received a warm welcome. Our room was clean and bright, very comfy beds, an easy to use safe, stocked mini bar and English channels on tv to catch up on the news. Apart from one or two fellow guests being obnoxiously noisy from 5am onwards (this can happen in any hotel) it was really peaceful and we slept well. The shower was a bit tiny and the room was extremely warm, those were our only niggles and both very minor ones at that. We didn't bother with breakfast, opting to take things at a slower pace and have pancakes etc in town instead so can't comment on the food. We came back before midnight a couple of times and had a few drinks at the bar before going to bed. The drinks were very reasonably priced and the staff very efficient and friendly, especially the assistant manager Roiger, who helped us with our drunken Dutch. All in all we felt we had got value for money with this hotel and would go back there again. We had no problems whatsoever with the staff, they do seem to adopt a no nonsense attitude to people speaking rudely to them though, and quite right too. Having paid far more for much less in both the UK and USA this hotel was overall good value and excellent for those who don't want noise all night.

Reviews.Title: “Management Don`t Care, Staff Understanding”
Reviews.Author: SydneyJosh
Reviews.Content: Good value for money considering the alternatives. However don`t stay on a weekday if you wish to sleep in. Jackhammers at 8am is not a pleasant thing to wake up to. Apparently management don`t care about their customers shown by the fact that they are renovating during peak summer season. Staff said that the workers were told not to start until after 9. We did get a reduction in price for the rude awakening. If we were told we could have planned accordingly. Despite this it was okay for the price. Skip breakfast and walk to the local night shop or kebab place instead for better value.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was ok / Das Hotel war ok”
Reviews.Author: windweit
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, close to the bus stop of Bus 32 and 33 that end at amsterdam central station, about a 10 minutes drive - though don't expect to get seats. The busses leave every 7 to (night) 15 minutes until 1:00 pm. Due to the holiday season (shortly before eastern) it was the best value hotel we could get (we looked for a quiet three star hotel not to far from the city. Breakfeast - when booked through Expedia - has to be ordered extra at 12 EUR per day per person. The hotel offers a standard buffet with continental and warm breakfast. We only booked it on the day we left. Breakfeast offers in Amsterdam City are a lot cheaper, just as good tasting and a lot more interesting. The room (Nr. 40) was clean and with enough space for the two of us. It looks out onto a quiet street. If you have a light sleep Nr. 40 ist not that good due to clapping corridor doors. Fellow guests were generally quiet as well. The In-Room-Safe was closed and they didn't manage to open it during our 4-night-stay. So our things were kept in the reception safe. My Laptop (about 35 cm wide) wouldn't have fitted into the safe anyway. Free Wifi worked and with sufficient speed as well. About ecology: Towels are changed every day, they should stop that, it's an unnessecary waste of water and detergent. I don't know about the bedclothes. Same thing with soap. Staff was friendly to neutral, but helpful (though we didn't need them very often).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam with a good friend hoping to have a fine time and see some sights. We booked last minute, and all the good hostels had no vacancies, so we decided to spend a little extra on a decent-looking hotel. Big. Mistake. We traveled all day and were exhausted, and by the time finally got to the front desk at 10pm, we were falling over. All we wanted was to check in and get a good night's sleep. But the man at the front desk was talking to another employee for what felt like twenty minutes, until finally I lost it and demanded a key. He gave us a real attitude, and had us fill out forms and went back to chatting. The next morning was alright. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel that takes you into the center of Amsterdam, so it's not that inconvenient. When we returned after a long day and night, my friend and I exchanged one of those "did they even clean the room" looks. Questionable. We stayed up very late, and decided we would sleep in until 11 the next morning. Well, that didn't happen because we were woken up at SEVEN IN THE MORNING by the sound of a JACKHAMMER. Yeah. They were doing constuction at SEVEN IN THE MORNING right down the hall from our room. I'm talking power drills, chainsaws, you name it, we heard it. Our bedframes were vibrating. I went to the front desk to complain, and they did NOTHING. They did not even offer us free breakfast. I asked to speak to the manager, and the girl at the front desk said I couldn't. She didn't speak English that well, and just kept saying, "No, no you can't talk to manager." She refused to do anything, and we were sooo angry. I highly reccomend staying away from this hotel. The food is bad, the location is fairly poor, and the decor is drab. Worst of all, the staff are unreliable, self-important, and act as if the guests are a pesky chore in addition to their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Bad attitude of staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When saying Amsterdam, this neighborhood is definitely not the place where you wanted to be. There is a direct bus link to Central Station though. The front staff is inexperienced, and has a selfish attitude. When asking for a copy, we were made to wait 10 minutes, without significant indication why we were made to do so. Then, we decided to go make a copy in the supermarket. I needed a taxi, then the `taxi cetrale` tefuses to come to the hotel. I`m told to let the front desk call a taxi. Doing so, the front desk asks me where I`m going. Not because there was a cozy atmosphere where staff and guests exchange personal things, NO, because the staff plays a lucrative bonus game with some favored taxi drivers. I confronted this barely 18 year old staff with the inappropriateness of his question. Then not-knowing where I need to go- he had greatest difficulties to call all different kind of mobile phones to taxis that give good pay to the hotel for airport bound traffic, where one call to the taxi centrale would do. In these different conversations a constant item was "He doesn`t want to tell" Finally there came a taxi, whose door didn`t close well, and even during the drive it once got open. The Bastion guest-rooms are oh so common. To summarize, the hotel isn`t there for you. You are there for the hotel staff. It`s a deception for business travelers, and also for tourists, it something to think about when all nice hotels are full.
